attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Do not uphold the ECJ ruling on Orams in the UK! 

We the undersigned, petition the UK Government to take the appropriate measures to ensure the forthcoming High Court case, Apostolides vs. Orams, will not hamper the chances of a comprehensive political settlement in Cyprus, nor override the fundamental rights of both British and Cypriot citizens. 

The ruling by the European Courts of Justice (ECJ) is flawed and we therefore demand urgent action for the following reasons:
• The UK Government must ensure both Greek and Turkish Cypriots are treated fairly 
• Thousands of British Citizens in the UK will be affected
• The Immovable Property Commission in North Cyprus already provides local remedies for property disputes
• The ECJ ruling must be annulled because the impartiality of the Greek judge involved is doubtful
• The peaceful co-existence of the British Cypriot communities in the UK may be adversely affected.

The UK Government needs to help achieve a permanent political solution and avoid the permanent division of Cyprus.

rejection.details: As stated in our terms and conditions, we cannot accept petitions regarding or referring to individual legal cases. Individual legal cases are a matter for direct communication with the Home Office.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
